tumor_size_max_dimension_evidence: Tumor size stated as 5.0 cm in greatest dimension in multiple sections of the report.
pT_stated: Not explicitly stated; tumor size 5.0 cm, peripheral location, no pleural invasion, no bronchus involvement
pT_evidence: Tumor size 5.0 cm corresponds to T2a (3-5 cm) per AJCC 7th edition; no pleural invasion or bronchus involvement noted, margins free of tumor.
pN_stated: No tumor seen in all examined lymph nodes (stations 7, 11, R4, hilar nodes)
pN_evidence: All lymph nodes examined (hilar, station 7, 11, R4) are negative for tumor.
tumor_stage_evidence: Based on AJCC 7th edition, T2a N0 corresponds to Stage IB; no evidence of distant metastasis.
histologic_diagnosis_evidence: Diagnosis clearly stated as poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma in the right upper lobe lung lobectomy specimen.
comment: The pathology report describes a poorly differentiated lung adenocarcinoma measuring 5.0 cm in greatest dimension located in the right upper lobe. The tumor is peripheral, circumscribed, and abutting but not invading the pleura. Surgical margins are free of tumor. No lymph node metastases were identified in multiple sampled stations (hilar, 7, 11, R4). There is no evidence of angiolymphatic or perineural invasion. Based on tumor size and nodal status, the tumor is staged as T2a N0, corresponding to Stage IB by AJCC 7th edition criteria. The report is comprehensive and provides sufficient data for accurate staging. No distant metastasis information is provided, so M category and overall stage IV cannot be assessed. Overall, the report supports a diagnosis of Stage IB lung adenocarcinoma with negative margins and lymph nodes.
